Covers

Covers describe how the base space is decomposed into overlapping sets. They are a required input to circle_bundles.build_bundle().

Cover objects store: - base points - membership information - the nerve of the cover - visualization and summary utilities

Base cover classes

3-simplices in the nerve: 4-way overlaps U_i ∩ U_j ∩ U_k ∩ U_l ≠ ∅.

Return type:

class circle_bundles.base_covers.TriangulationStarCover(base_points, K_preimages, K, vertex_coords_dict, metric=None)[source]

Cover by open stars of vertices in a triangulation K. Uses K_preimages: the location of each base point in |K| coordinates.

Expected:

  • K.get_simplices() yields (simplex_tuple, filtration_value) like Gudhi.

  • vertex_coords_dict maps old_vertex_id -> coords (D,)

Parameters:

  • base_points (ndarray)

  • K_preimages (np.ndarray)

  • K (Any)

  • vertex_coords_dict (dict)

  • metric (Any)

Common cover builders

circle_bundles.make_s2_fibonacci_star_cover(base_points, *, n_vertices=256, eps=1e-12)[source]

S^2 star cover built from the convex-hull triangulation of Fibonacci landmarks.

Return type:

TriangulationStarCover

Parameters:

  • base_points (ndarray)

  • n_vertices (int)

  • eps (float)

Notes

  • Overlap order <= 3 (each point lies in one hull face => 3 vertex stars).

  • Fast: no “search all triangles”; we use the hit facet index.

circle_bundles.make_rp2_fibonacci_star_cover(base_points, *, n_pairs=256, landmark_oversample=20, landmark_seed=0, eps=1e-12, atol=1e-12)[source]

RP^2 star cover built from a symmetric hull triangulation.

Return type:

RP2StarCover

Parameters:

  • base_points (ndarray)

  • n_pairs (int)

  • landmark_oversample (int)

  • landmark_seed (int | None)

  • eps (float)

  • atol (float)

Pipeline

  1. Canonicalize samples to hemisphere reps P_rep (RP^2 reps).

  2. Choose n_pairs well-spread RP^2 landmark reps via:

    Fibonacci(oversample*n_pairs) + hemisphere + RP^2 FPS

    Call these L_rp2 (shape (n,3)).

  3. Lift landmarks upstairs to S^2 by adding antipodes:

    V_full = [L_rp2; -L_rp2] (shape (2n,3))

  4. Triangulate upstairs via convex hull.

  5. For each sample [x], compute ray-hit + barycentric weights for both lifts x and -x.

  6. Push both contributions down to RP^2 vertex ids and sum weights; keep top-3.

  7. Build U/POU; compute witnessed Čech nerve from U.

Cover inspection and visualization

Cover objects provide methods such as:

  • summarize — display basic statistics and diagnostics

  • show_nerve — visualize the nerve complex

See individual class documentation for details.
